reviews.text: It's a big hotel, with huge corridors and a flavour of the Sixties. Rooms are aither renovated or unrenovated. We stayed in an unrenovated room (for 120 USD!), with old (not antique!) furniture, a rather basic bathroom and a heating system over which we had no control. The good part is the thermal bath, really nice, and the excellent breakfast.
reviews.title: Mixed feeling
Sublime Waters
reviews.text: A recommendation: if you stay there, DO NOT go to have dinner at a close-by restaurant called "The White house". Beside a very poor and very slow service, and after receiving plates that did not corrsepond to what we had ordered, we received a bill in which each plate costed 50 % more of the price that was indicated in the menu, probably just because we are foreigners, and we had to dispute with the waiter to have a correct bill.

You are in a great hotel, rooms are newly done, hotel was everything we hoped, it is $170 per night but it is worth it. there are other less priced hotels all aroung but if you want first class accomidations Celik Palas is the place
reviews.title: Not for budget travelers,First class all the way if you willing to pay

reviews.text: I went to Bursa for a one- night stay business trip and luckily this hotel was booked for me. I was pretty impressed with the hotel rooms and also liked the decoration. I had the chance to visit when it was snowing so the surronding was all white and also beautiful. The hotel has a hamam (Turkish bath) and SPA facilities which unfortunately did not had a change to use. However, I want to re-visit the hotel once it snows and would like to take my parents with me. I would not say it is a hotel for couples but a for chilling out with parents.
reviews.title: good renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really relaxing 2 night stay at the Celik Palas Hotel. The Thermal Spa area was absolutely magical with its hot spring, pool and saunas. The hotel is expensive at Euro 160 per night and not providing us with complimentary water except for the first night detracted from its class. The breakfast every morning was outstanding and the staff most helpful.
reviews.title: Magical Stay

reviews.text: I highly recommend the Celik Palas Hotel and would stay again if in the area.
reviews.title: Simply perfect accomodation

reviews.text: I used to stay other hotels when i come to bursa but this time one of my college from the factory recommended me Hotel Celik Palas.I booked a single room and it was quite big and very comfortable with an amazing view Bursa.Hotel staff was very friendly and helpfull.Service was absolutely good enough.This time i couldn't have time to try Spa&Thermal side but next time i will definitely will.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing about Turkey, you have to be very careful about hotel prices they are not consistent, I called the hotel directly and they told me that the price is 120 Turkish lira about 100 dollars at the time and it included breakfast. In their website the price of the same room was 200 Turkish lira. Overall the hotel is very comfortable. If you can find the deal that we got that would be great. its worth it, the rooms have very comfortable beds. with bathrobes. and very large bathrooms. the breakfast was great, It included alot of cheeses breads and eggs. The location is not that great, you do have to take a car or a taxi to the center of town for sight seeing, The staff of the hotel were friendly, they let us use their computer to check the internet,
reviews.title: comfortable

likes.liked: — the rooms had great views of Bursa
likes.disliked: — the beds were comfortable but small.

reviews.text: One of the best hotels i have ever been. The room was spacious with 1 bathroom & 1 shower, warm, very clean and luxurious. Everybody was friendly. The buffet restaurant was just perfect. Delicious food! I had a great stay in Celik Palas and look forward to going there again.
reviews.title: Amazing Accommodation in Turkey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Celik Palas in Sept. of '06. All I can say that is positive is that the property looks very nice from the street. Having the reputation of being the best hotel in Bursa, we were quite looking forward to our stay there. We were in for a rude awakening. After paying an arm and a leg for a room, we were stuck in a very small room overlooking the parking lot. The furniture was old and there was a musky/moldy smell in the room. Everything was damp and the air conditioning running at full blast did nothing but blow hot air. The walls, the carpeting, as well as the furniture looked old and dirty. The bathroom looked old and dingy. (nice terrycloth robes were provided though) In all, I cannot recommend this place to anyone at any price, much less the exorbitant price we paid for the miserable hot sleepless night we spent there. Stay away from this property!
reviews.title: What a ripoff!

reviews.text: My husband I booked a suit room and a semi suit room for my family from Japan. We were 5 people, and we told the hotel that each guest needs one bed as we are all adult. Arriving the hotel, we found that there were total 2 double beds, and we had to change the rooms to normal rooms. Though this was a fault of the hotel, there was no apology, on top of that they said to us to leave the hotel if we were not happy to stay in the hotel. This hotel is supposed to be a 5-stars hotel, and has good reputation among the local people, but I could not believe the attitude of the receptionists. It was totally unacceptable.
reviews.title: Good hotel with bad receptionists

likes.disliked: — The receptionists. They were really rude.
